utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Keep it comin’, pal. You’re doing great.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: Say, maybe you can help me. I’m looking for a dame.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Aren’t we all.

utterance.speaker: JOE
utterance.content: This one’s special. You know her?

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Know her? I’m looking at her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talk about a slice of history. The Pennybaker Club. You know, back in the 40s all the greats played here. If these walls could talk, man, the stories they would tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the only story we need to hear is about –

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Stan Banks, single GSW to the sternum. I’m calling the time of death between 6 and 8 this morning. Looks like he tried to defend himself with this ; obviously it didn’t work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So robbery gone wrong?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, still had his wallet, cell, and a room key from the Parksville Lawns, so…

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Pockets were pulled out indicating the killer searched the body. For what, we have no idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s weird. He’s got an SRO key but his driver’s license has him living on 34th Street.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll hit the SRO. See if there’s anything we can find out about him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You looking for a drink, Castle? ‘Cause I’m pretty sure the bar is closed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I was looking for a clue. I think I found one. Some homeless guy’s squat and today’s Ledger. He was here this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whoever he is, maybe he saw something. I’ll get patrol units to canvass the area.

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Stan’s dead? Well, that’s just great. What am I supposed to do with all his ... crap?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’ll be taking … some of it off your hands for our investigation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know of anyone that’s been threatening Stan lately?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: I’m the manager here, not the den mother.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay then. When was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Uh, this morning. Stan was all smiles. Gave notice that he was moving out ‘cause his ship was coming in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What ship?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. The Titanic by the looks of things.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, if you can remember anything else can you please give me a call?

utterance.speaker: MANAGER
utterance.content: Don’t hold your breath, hot shot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think she likes you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was the last time you spoke with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doubloon? As in, old Spanish coin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s the fella that found that sunken Confederate ship ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A blue – like an insect?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was he having problems with anyone that you know of?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing in Stan’s personal effects about butterflies, blue or otherwise.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just a bunch of books about mobsters in Manhattan in the 40s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s all right. Because I got a hit on that threatening money call to Stan’s wife and it turns out it came from a dry cleaners.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe clothes aren’t the only thing they’re laundering. I’ll check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, this diary in Stan’s stuff. It’s also from the 40s. It sounds like it belonged to a private eye. Listen to this. “Usually the wives turn on the waterworks when shown pictures of their husbands stepping out, but not this dame. She wanted payback. So what’s worse? That I pitched woo with a client, or that I billed her for services rendered after?”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cute? I mean, this guy sounds like a hard boiled PI right out of a Raymond Chandler novel. I wonder why Stan had this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey yo, Beckett. Still got no word on that homeless guy, but a bodega owner saw a white Mustang parked in the loading zone right outside the club for the past three days.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay. See if anyone saw those license plates.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um … Beckett? Can I take this home for the night? I mean, It might be the key to what Stan was looking for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just want to read it because you think it’s cool.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, that too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, just so long as you … … bring it back … in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Aren’t we all.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Know her? I’m looking at her.

utterance.speaker: TOM DEMPSEY
utterance.content: You know who I am?

utterance.speaker: DEMPSEY
utterance.content: A wise guy. I like wise guys about as much as I like crumbs eyeballin’ my girl. It’s rude. Uncivil. That’s okay, Fred. The boys here are going to teach you some lessons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The Blue Butterfly! It’s a necklace! That’s why Stan Banks was killed. Why am I narrating?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So anything on that threatening call to the dry cleaners?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, the owner claims he doesn’t know anything about Stan or blue butterflies. However, a guy named Ray Horton rents out a back room. Turns out, Ray is a bookie on parole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so maybe Stan was trying to meet Ray at the Pennybaker so he could pay off some debts?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Ray was not there because of his debt. He was not even there about a blue butterfly. He was there about the Blue Butterfly. It’s a necklace. A butterfly shaped centerpiece made entirely out of blue diamonds worth about a million dollars, easy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are you getting all of this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From the PI’s diary.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Stan was on a treasure hunt.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Did a little research. Turns out the Blue Butterfly disappeared some time in the 40s. And, rumor has it, it’s hidden somewhere in the Pennybaker Club. If he found it, a million dollar necklace? Talk about a motive for murder. By the way, Ryan, say "boyo".

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy o.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: BOY-o.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy-o.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: BOY-o.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: BOY-o.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy yo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyway. Did some searching on the net, there wasn’t a lot there, but I found it’s supposedly cursed and at one time belonged to an SS officer’s mistress. After the war, made its way stateside, and into the hands of mob boss Tom Dempsey, who owned the club. Which is why we need to go back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You remember the green rod we found in Stan’s hand? Apparently Dempsey’s downstairs office was painted shamrock green. Stan had to have gone down there. Also according to the diary, the Blue Butterfly was kept in the secret safe in Dempsey’s office. It’s very possible we missed something. We never really looked down there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Ryan, you see if you can get a hold of the bookie. Castle and I’ll go back to the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boy-o.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy-o.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: BOY-o.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Boy-o.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like a leprechaun.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the PI tells Sally that he found her sister here, at the Pennybaker Club.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did Sally go talk to her sister?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, no. Joe could tell that Sally, being an innocent girl from the country, she was a little bit nervous about dealing with mobsters, so he offered to go back and make contact with Vera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Out of the goodness of his heart, I’m sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you blame the guy? I mean, she was gorgeous. So anyway, Joe tells Sally he’s going to go arrange a meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sally agreed, but again, insisted that Joe not tell Vera that she was looking for her because of all the animosity back home.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah! I was right. I bet that’s where he got the steel rod, which is probably what he used to pry open the secret safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hate to burst bubbles, Castle, but this hasn’t held anything in years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like Stan was disappointed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he probably would have been. If that was the secret safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not the secret safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here’s a fun fact – people often kept two safes. One that was easy to find, for minor valuables, and a second safe that was much harder to locate, for the extra specials. Like Blue Butterflies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, where’s the secret safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m coming to that. So it’s five days since Joe and Vera met. And they were very much in love.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: After only five days? C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, people didn’t waste time back in the 40s. Matter of fact, they were so much in love they risked it all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what does that have to do with our secret safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It happened backstage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right upstairs. They were stealing a moment together, which was dangerous because she was Dempsey’s girl. As they stared into each others eyes, Kate’s heart quickened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you just say Kate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you picturing the PI as you and me as the gangster’s moll?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? No. And I didn’t say Kate, I said fate. Fate’s heart quickened. I was being poetic. Anyway, as I was saying… They were just about to kiss when –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And … that’s it. That was the last entry in the diary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean that’s it? What happened to Joe? What happened to Vera?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, why would you tell a story when you don’t know the ending?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you wanted a beginning, a middle, and an end I have 27 novels you can choose from.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so where is the secret safe?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. I think Stan must have found it. Maybe that’s why he needed that rod. Pry open a wall or something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at the molding. What? It’s unlocked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stan found it. That’s why he was killed. But by whom?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ray Horton. Assault, battery, and now you’re using a dry cleaners to front your bookmaking operation.

utterance.speaker: RAY HORTON
utterance.content: Whoa, slow your roll. A man on parole like myself can’t be mixed up in bookmaking.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How about murder, Ray? Is it okay to get mixed up in that?

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: Stan? Who – who killed him?

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: Me? Why would I kill my business partner?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Your business partner? C’mon.

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: It’s true, man. One of my clients hooked us up. He knew that I was looking to diversify and that Stan needed financing to find this lost necklace. Stan told me he needed 10 Gs for expenses to buy this old private detective’s diary, so I agreed to back him for half the profits.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If all that’s true, then why did you threaten Stan’s wife?

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: ‘Cause Stan was ducking me. I thought I got played. But then he came up to me two days ago and he told me what’s up. He said he found the man with the missing piece of the puzzle to the Blue Butterfly.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And who’s this man?

utterance.speaker: RAY
utterance.content: I don’t know. But if Stan found the Blue Butterfly that’s probably who killed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I traced the diary. Stan did his research. He purchased it from the daughter of Joe’s old secretary. A woman by the name of Ruth Huntsacker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I spoke to Ms. Huntsacker. She said she still might have some of the PI’s old papers and they might be able to tell us what happened. She’s going to have her son look for them and then call me back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look Castle, I admit that Joe and Vera’s story is fun and romantic, but whatever happened back in 1947 has nothing to do with who murdered Stan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, I’m not so sure about that. Our bookie alibied out, but ballistics came in and we got a match. The .38 caliber revolver that killed Stan was used in an unsolved double homicide … in 1947.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I knew there was a connection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who were the victims?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … some lady named Vera Mulqueen and a private detective named Joe Flynn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Murdered. That’s too bad. I really thought those two crazy kids were going to make it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, not exactly the ending I was hoping for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t even know ballistics went back that far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, since the 20s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Being that it’s an old case, there’s not much in the system. Remains of Joe Flynn and Vera Mulqueen were found in Flynn’s car. It was parked in the alley of the Pennybaker Club. Both victims we shot with a .38 revolver and the car was set on fire. The only suspect was Tom Dempsey but there was never enough evidence to arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I bet you Dempsey caught the two of them trying to run away together and he killed them. But how does Stan’s killer get Dempsey’s gun 60 years later?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unless … Dempsey killed Stan. He’d be what, like 90 years old, but it’s still possible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Couldn’t have been Dempsey. He died of a heart attack 4 months after Joe and Vera were killed.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still… we should dig up that 1947 police report. There could be something in there about the gun that could shed light on Stan’s murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right. I’ll go to the warehouse and pull up the old case files.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, oh! Ah… I want to go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh… okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I drive?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t care.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So, I’ve been searching guns that Dempsey used to own. Turns out there was an estate sale where a treasure hunter named Clyde Belasco bought all of Dempsey’s firearms, including two .38s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, Clyde Belasco? Stan’s wife said that the two of them watched a documentary about him and that inspired Stan to become a treasure hunter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the connections don’t stop there. Belasco just flew in from France a week ago and I just found an article that said he searched for the Blue Butterfly for 15 years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That bookie said that Stan found someone that had the missing piece of the puzzle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Belasco is that someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Here it is. This has been dusted off recently.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like we’re not the only ones interested in this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Stan was here. It had to be. Think about it. The diary, the murders. All we’re doing is walking in his footsteps. This is the next piece of the puzzle.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Huh. Crime scene photo of Vera and the PI.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Damn it, Joe. You old sap. Dizzy with a dame and got yourself cooked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Mr. Bogart, what exactly are we looking for here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our 1947 murders and our present day murder have to be connected by more than just a gun. Somewhere in here is that connection.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE BELASCO
utterance.content: Yes, I bought several of Tom Dempsey’s revolvers. And by all means, test fire every last one of them as you wish.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We will. Now, how do you know Stan?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: You have to understand, I’m on television. Articles are written about me. Because of this, the amateurs come knocking. It’s a … occupational hazard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was the purpose of Stan’s visit?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Why, the Blue Butterfly, of course. He must have read of my exploits searching for it and decided to burden me with his preposterous story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And what story was that?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: That he had found an old private investigator's diary which held missing clues.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You didn’t believe him?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Of course not. When I asked to see the alleged diary, he refused. And yet, he wanted access to all my research on the Pennybaker Club. I mean really, the whole thing was absurd. He even asked to exit out the back door, said a car was following him. Was a white Mustang.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: I guess someone else was interested in the Blue Butterfly, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s like we’re looking for a needle in a haystack, except for we can’t find the haystack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who needs a haystack when the needle is right here? This is a statement from Joe’s secretary, Mrs. Cunard, that was taken right after his death. “Mrs. Florence Cunard, secretary to the victim, Joe Flynn, attested to bearing witness to the following conversation between both victims on the morning of June 24th, 1947.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What happens next?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. That’s the end of the statement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But if Sally wasn’t Vera’s sister then who was she?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sally set up the PI. It’s a classic film noir twist.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was Sally up to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you think she was connected to Dempsey?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know! Isn’t this great?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So our uniforms got a line on that homeless guy who was squatting in the Pennybaker. A hotdog vendor ID’d him. Said the guy goes by the name of Westside Wally. I put a want out on the guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. That might be the break we need to catch Stan’s killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hello. What? When? All right, I’m on my way. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That was the manager of Stan’s residency hotel. A guy driving a white Mustang just forced his way into Stan’s room. He’s still there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD, show us your hands!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Show us your hands, now!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn around slowly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re Tom Dempsey.

utterance.speaker: TOM DEMPSEY
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tom Dempsey the Third.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dead ringer. Complete doppelgänger.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: It’s DNA, guys. It’s not a magic trick. I’m his grandson. All right, look. I’m sorry I broke in a door. I’ll pay for the damages. It’s no big deal. Why am I still here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we were just curious to see if you inherited anything else from your grandfather, aside from his looks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like one of his .38 revolvers that you used to kill Stan Banks.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. That didn’t happen. Look, Stan came to me, only he told me his name was Nathaniel Jenkins. He said he was a biographer, said he wanted to do a story about my grandfather. He promised not to focus on his underworld dealings, just on the good stuff. Like how my granddad was a pillar of the community.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like a killer of the community.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And so when he made his pitch, you, wanting to rehabilitate your family name, cooperated.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Yeah. I gave him access to all granddad’s old papers and everything was cool. ‘Til I found out everything was a lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how’d you do that?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: There’s this singer that used to headline at my granddad’s club. Betsy Sinclair. A couple weeks ago she passed away. Well, I went there to pay my respects and who do I see there but Nathaniel chatting up this old guy. He sees me, jets out the back. I’m like, what the hell is this all about, right? So I look in the guest book and I figured it out. He signed his real name. Stan Banks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is when you figured out he wasn’t really a biographer?

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: He was just another lowlife treasure hunter looking for the Blue Butterfly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if anyone deserved the Blue Butterfly, it was you, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you followed Stan. And when Stan found it, you shot him.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I didn’t – I did not shoot him. Stan – wait – Stan did find it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon. You tell us.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: I don’t know. I was not there. I read in the newspaper that the guy was dead. I went to his apartment to see what I could find. And I didn’t kill the guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dempsey’s alibi holds up. He didn’t kill Stan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s all right. Because we caught a break. Unis finally tracked down Westside Wally. They’re bringing him in now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great. Maybe that can shed some light as to what happened to Stan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if he can’t, maybe Jerry Maddox can.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerry Maddox?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You remember how Tom the Third told us that Stan went to Betsy Sinclair’s funeral? I started thinking, why would he go?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: To do research.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But research on whom? So I stopped by the funeral parlor. Turns out that Stan spent an awful lot of time with a friend of the deceased named Jerry Maddox. And get this. Jerry was the old bartender at the Pennybaker Club. And probably the last living link to the Blue Butterfly.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Good job, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: FRANKIE
utterance.content: Jerry? This is Detective Beckett and Mr. Castle. They wanted a word?

utterance.speaker: JERRY MADDOX
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA MADDOX
utterance.content: You want some soup? It’s homemade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t mind if I do. That smells delicious.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no thank you. Actually, we’re all right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Am I hearing “I Can’t Give You Anything But Love”?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: That’s right, kid. That’s the best version of that song, too. Come here to talk music, did ya?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we’re here to investigate Stan Banks’ murder, and we were wondering if you met him at Betsy Sinclair’s funeral.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: He … uh… he was murdered?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Poor kid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he mention a necklace called the Blue Butterfly?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh, sure. Asked me all kinds of questions, where it might be, stuff like that. But I was just a bartender back then. I wasn’t much help.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now this might seem an odd question, but in 1947 do you remember when Vera Mulqueen and Joe Flynn were murdered?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: ‘Course. It was a big deal back then. Dempsey, the fella that owned the club, shot them in cold blood.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Same year, do you remember a woman named Sally Scofield? She was a redhead. In 1947 she would have been about 18.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Oh! I think I know who you’re talking about. That was back in ’46. I had just got hired at the Pennybaker.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Dempsey wasn’t dating Vera back then. He was going with a girl named Priscilla Campbell. Priscilla had a daughter, a redhead named Sally. Sounds like she’s the one you mean. Sad story, what happened. Not long after Vera caught Dempsey’s eye he dropped Priscilla and cut her and Sally off cold. They said it was the curse of the Blue Butterfly. Priscilla killed herself with a handful of pills.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Sally?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Couple months after Vera and that PI got whacked, Dempsey died of a heart attack. The evening of his funeral in walks Sally, all dressed up. Ordered a whiskey neat, slammed it back, gave me a big old crocodile grin, said she was free. And she strutted on out the door and that’s the last time I ever saw her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a revenge story. Sally blamed Vera for the death of her mother, so she plotted to take her down. Somehow she used the PI to do it. She must have been setting them up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but how does any of this help us figure out who shot Stan?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So, Westside Wally. May I call you Wally?

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: I prefer Westside.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: ‘Course. Westside, we know you were at the Pennybaker Club two days ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, we found your squat.

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: Whoa, Cagney and Lacey. You can stop right there. I wasn’t living in the club two days ago. I had already gotten bought out by the other guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Bought out?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: By the other guy?

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: A few days ago the other guy comes in, starts setting up a squat by the door, but Westside Wally doesn’t do neighbors. So I said, hey professor, kick rocks. He wouldn’t take no for an answer. Ended up paying me $400 dollars to relocate. So again, for the record this time, I wasn’t there!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Easy. Easy, okay? Did you get this guy’s name?

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: I didn’t ask, he didn’t say.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you describe him?

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: Medium height, medium build, white, 50s. I called him the professor. Because he spoke like a pretentious jerk.

utterance.speaker: WALLY
utterance.content: Hey… it’s the professor.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Clyde Belasco.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you were at the Pennybaker Club, Mr. Belasco. You paid off a homeless man so that you could have the place to yourself.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: I have a condo on the Upper East Side, a chateau in Bordeaux, a chalet in Gstaad, and yet on the word of some vagrant you believe that I paid to squat in an abandoned building? Me? Clyde Belasco?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: I’d like you see you prove it, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Have it your way, professor. We will see you at the sentencing hearing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You can do your TV show from prison.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Okay, I was there. I admit it. I was at the Pennybaker Club when Stan was killed. But I didn’t kill him. Like I said before, Stan came to me and asked for my research on the Blue Butterfly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you said no?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Of course I said no. I searched for the necklace for 15 years and now I’m just supposed to help him? The glory was to be mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you knew he was on to something, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: Oh yes. I could tell he was close, so very close. Stan knew things about the club, about the necklace, that I had never heard before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you staked out the club and when Stan showed you shot him.

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: I didn’t shoot him, Detective. Yes, I had a pistol with me. And a bullwhip. They’re my trademarks. Everyone knows that. But I brought a mask and gloves as well because I was simply going to threaten him and take the prize.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what happened?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: I was lying in wait. Stan went downstairs and when he returned, he was holding the Blue Butterfly. Oh, you should have seen how it sparkled. Magnificent. I was about to pounce when suddenly there was a rag put over my mouth. It had a sweet smell, like it was doused with chloroform.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chloroform? Really?

utterance.speaker: CLYDE
utterance.content: It had to be. Everything went dark and when I came to, Stan was dead. I searched his body but whoever knocked me out took the Blue Butterfly with them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: God, I hope it’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but without a confession our case is purely circumstantial. I’m gonna see if I can get a warrant for Belasco’s place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which place? The condo, the chateau, or the chalet?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, this is Detective Kate Beckett, 12th Precinct. I’m calling for the writing ADA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Yeah okay, I’ll hold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s kind of disappointing. I was really hoping that solving Stan’s murder would give us some answers to what really happened to Joe and Vera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but we already know what happened. Dempsey killed them both.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s the obvious version. But what about Sally? What’s her part in all this and why would she hire Joe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess we’ll never know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, something else was going on. Something we’re missing. “Wearing T-strap shoes and a country suit, I could tell that redhead was a hick off the cob.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, what did you just say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s just how Joe described her in his diary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, the part about the shoes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: T-strap. It’s when the strap comes over the –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Can I just call you back?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, take a look at this photo. There’s a shoe next to the car. And look at what kind of shoe it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a T-strap. You don’t think -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If Vera was at the club that night she’d be dressed in an elegant dress and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And heels. This isn’t Vera. This is Sally.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but it can’t be Sally. The bartender said that he saw her months after the murders. Unless –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_BECKETT
utterance.content: He lied.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But that was over half a century ago. Why would he lie about that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, I just realized something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “I Can’t Give You Anything But Love”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: W – what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what was playing when we interviewed the bartender.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. Right … he said that that was the best version of the song.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was Louis Armstrong’s version. In Joe’s diary he says his favorite performer is Satchmo. What’s Satchmo’s real name?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Louis Armstrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put it all together, the answer is clear.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Oh… hello again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello, Vera.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And hello, Joe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it isn’t Vera Mulqueen and Joe Flynn, back from the dead.

utterance.speaker: FRANKIE
utterance.content: Everything all right, guys?

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Everything’s peachy, thanks, Frankie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened? Stan figured out the truth? That you two were alive? That you murdered two people so you could disappear with the Blue Butterfly? So you lured him to the club and then you shot him?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Lady, you got it all wrong. Stan cornered me at Betsy’s funeral, wanted to know how I knew her. So I lied, told him I was the bartender.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: He – Stan was clever. He was too clever. He figured us out. He came here demanding to know where the Blue Butterfly was. He threatened to expose us.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: He was like a dog after a bone. So we told him what he needed to know. We told him where it was. But we didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh c’mon, you guys. We know it’s you. You used the same gun from the ’47 murders to kill Stan.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Same gun? We keep that gun in the –

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: China cabinet!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t even think about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put the gun down.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Francis Benjamin Huntsacker, what have you done?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Huntsacker?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was your mother who sold the diary to Stan.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: What diary?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your diary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you read it. And all this time you were looking for the necklace, too.

utterance.speaker: FRANKIE
utterance.content: That’s why I got this crap job. And for six months I built trust, gently acquired information, and that jerk just waltzes in here and bullies the location of the Blue Butterfly from you? C’mon!

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: So when you realized it was now or never, you bushwhacked Stan and took the Blue Butterfly for yourself.

utterance.speaker: FRANKIE
utterance.content: I brought their old .38 only as a precaution. I was just gonna chloroform Stan and steal it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you found Clyde Belasco hiding behind the bar.

utterance.speaker: FRANKIE
utterance.content: I pulled the gun, Stan grabbed for it. I didn’t mean to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go, Frankie. You’re under arrest.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Castle, guess what we found at Frankie’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my. Oh my God. It’s beautiful.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s fake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We confirmed it with an appraiser. It’s well-crafted costume jewelry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All this time, and it’s paste? That’s – or maybe it’s a twist on a twist. Maybe the real Blue Butterfly was switched out for this one years ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whatever happened, it doesn’t change the facts. We still have one more case to close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so now we know that Frankie killed Stan, but there are two murders that need to be solved. Sally Campbell and whoever else you put in that car.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s time you come clean on what happened the evening of June 24th, 1947. The night you disappeared.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Tell ‘em, Vera.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: We were all huddled around the radio, listening to the Sugar Ray Robinson, Jimmy Doyle prize fight.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: I was building up nerve to make my escape.

utterance.speaker: TOM
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah … make it quick.

utterance.speaker: LENNY
utterance.content: Well. Aren’t you a picture.

utterance.speaker: LENNY
utterance.content: I’m with her.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: The guy was Sally’s husband. She’d only hired Joe to get me away from Dempsey so she could exact her revenge.

utterance.speaker: LENNY
utterance.content: Wait, Sal. Let me get the ice first.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: We were hot as a pistol and – and – and we had two bodies on our hands and we had to do something.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Joe had the plan.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: No one would be looking for those two. We needed to disappear.

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: Obviously we didn’t disappear far enough. So. Are you going to arrest us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would I do that? Sounds like self-defense. Besides, we’re looking for a woman named Vera, not Viola. And a PI named Joe, not a former bartender named Jerry.

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: We don’t know how to thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do. Answer two questions. One, if you had the Blue Butterfly, why didn’t you take it? And two, where has it been all this time?

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: Well, we were home free until doll face here had herself an epiphany.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cursed or not, did you ever consider going back for it?

utterance.speaker: VIOLA
utterance.content: They don’t get it, Joe. I –

utterance.speaker: JERRY
utterance.content: We got four children, seven grandchildren, two great grandchildren. And each other. What do we need a Blue Butterfly for?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think we should have told Joe and Vera about the Blue Butterfly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no. Why ruin it for them? Now that’s the stuff that dreams are made of.
